title: Affidavit: Constable's wife shot him after alleged affair
content:
SMITH COUNTY, TX (KLTV) -
Officials have released an arrest warrant for a woman accused of shooting a Smith County constable.
Meraland Taylor Jackson, 66, is charged with two counts of aggravated assault with a deadly weapon, family violence after police say she shot her husband, Pct. 1 Constable Henry Jackson.
According to the affidavit, obtained Monday, Meraland Jackson told police she shot her husband because she believed he was having an affair with a coworker.
"Jackson continued to make ... statements that she intentionally shot her husband, Henry Jackson, and that he should be dead, and that she accidentally shot her grand-daughter," the documents read.
READ MORE: Wife arrested after shooting constable
The affidavit states that during an interview with police, Jackson continued to state that she shot her husband intentionally. She also told deputies that her husband of more than 40 years had recently been out of town for a work-related conference and she had learned that his alleged mistress had attended the conference as well.
The shooting occurred about 7:30 p.m. Saturday in the 3200 block of Chandler Highway.
Law enforcement officials say Henry Jackson was shot one time. The Jacksons' 5-year-old granddaughter was also shot in the ankle. They were both transported to ETMC by ambulance. Hospital officials listed the constable in fair condition at this time. His granddaughter was treated at the hospital Saturday and released on Sunday.
Meraland Jackson was taken to the Smith County Jail. Her bond was set at $500,000 and was released Sunday evening after posting bond.
